justification: The Method section states that participants "completed the General Trust Scale (Yamagishi, 1986)", indicating this scale operationalizes the construct of general trust.

To obtain individual altruism values, the authors "used the method outlined by Mizuno & Shimizu (2023)", where participants make allocation choices; the resulting parameter quantifies altruism within Social Value Orientation.

The same allocation task is used to compute an "equality parameter," explicitly described as measuring how much participants value equal outcomes, thus capturing the equality facet of Social Value Orientation.

Throughout the paper the Public Goods Game is described as the experimental task where participants decide how much to contribute, and the resulting contribution levels are analyzed as indicators of cooperation.
